lawnlayer

Class App

  • java.lang.Object
    • processing.core.PApplet
      • lawnlayer.App
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    processing.core.PConstants

    public class App
extends processing.core.PApplet
    Base class for the game. Represents the gameboard that has general control and stores all attributes and objects of this game instance.

        public void setup()
        Load all resources such as images, JSON data (See parseJSON(String)). Called once when the program starts.
        Overrides:
        setup in class processing.core.PApplet

      • modifyLife

        public void modifyLife(int n)
        Modifys the number of remaining lives in this game instance.
        Parameters:
        n - integer to be added to the remaining lives (negative for decrementation)

      • updateScore

        public void updateScore()
        Updates the current score of this level. The score is calculated as (filled grass objects / all soil tile objects) * 100 in percentage. This percentage is rounded up.

      • checkWinLose

        public void checkWinLose()
        Checks if the game is won or lost. This function is called either when score is updated (updateScore()), or when lives changed (modifyLife(int)). Won if goal reached. If more levels to come, call upon a new level. Otherwise, display a win screen. Lost if no lives left. Display a lose screen. See parseLevel(Level) and displayScreen(boolean, String).

      • displayScreen

        public void displayScreen(boolean win,
                          java.lang.String text)
        Displays a screen overlay when game finishes. The game stops all executions.
        Parameters:
        win - true if game is won, false if game is lost
        text - text to display on screen

      • newPlayer

        public void newPlayer()
        Nullifys the current player reference. Spawn in a new player at the top left of the tilemap.

      • parseLevel

        public void parseLevel(Level level)
        Parses level and sets current level. Objects to be parsed in the level includes: tilemap (parseTiles(String)), enemies (parseEnemies(Level)), player (newPlayer()).
        Parameters:
        level - the level to be parsed

      • parseJSON

        public void parseJSON(java.lang.String path)
        Parses config JSON file to get a list of levels. See also JSONObject, JSONArray.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of config file

      • parseTiles

        public TileObject[][] parseTiles(java.lang.String filename)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parse level.txt file to update tilemap
        Parameters:
        filename - the file that contains level map
        Returns:
        the 2d tilemap
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if invalid map

      • parseEnemies

        public void parseEnemies(Level level)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parse enemy data to spawn enemies and update enemy list
        Parameters:
        level - the level to get the data from
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if spawn too near edges of game area (keep 1 block away from walls)

      • parsePowerup

        public void parsePowerup(Level level)
        Parses powerup sprite for this level. The type of powerup is based on the key string obtained from the config file when the config file was parsed.
        Parameters:
        level - the level to get the data from

      • updatePowerup

        public void updatePowerup()
        Updates the state of powerup. If last powerup still in effect, decrement duration timer. Otherwise, restore states and sprites of agents (enemies and player).

        1. Powerup present in game: If player consumes powerup: generate effect (See Enemy.freeze(), Enemy.setVulnerable(boolean)); set sprites (See GameObject.setSprite(PImage)); play sound effect (See playSound(String)). If grass area swallows powerup: remove without effect.

        2. Powerup not present in game: If last powerup still in effect: return If no in-effect powerup: start decrementing delay interval timer If delay timer finish: generate another random delay timer; spawn in a new powerup (parsePowerup(Level)).

      • updateTexts

        public void updateTexts()
        Updates all texts on screen.

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Draw all elements in the game by current frame [called automatically, should never be called explicitly. This should be controlled with PApplet.noLoop(), PApplet.redraw() and PApplet.loop()]
        Overrides:
        draw in class processing.core.PApplet

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed()
        Called every frame to detect if a key is down.
        Overrides:
        keyPressed in class processing.core.PApplet
        See Also:
        Player.pressUp(), Player.pressRight(), Player.pressDown(), Player.pressLeft()

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased()
        Called every frame to detect if a key is released.
        Overrides:
        keyReleased in class processing.core.PApplet
        See Also:
        Player.releaseUp(), Player.releaseRight(), Player.releaseDown(), Player.releaseLeft()

      • playSound

        public void playSound(java.lang.String path)
               throws javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException,
                      java.io.IOException,
                      javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException
        Plays the sound clip specified by the file path.
        Parameters:
        path - the file path string
        Throws:
        javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException - if audio file not supported
        java.io.IOException - if fails to open a file
        javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException - if audio file is unavailable or being used by other applications
